understanding.p: A topic is a web page or a section in a print document. A topic must follow a schema and it must belong to a topic-set. A topic appears under the topic-set folder in an HTML document or as an entry in a print document's table of contents. It is not possible to present topics in a specific order within a topic-set.

planning-question.planning-question-title: What do I need before adding a new topic?

planning-question-body.p: Before you add a topic, you must decide whether to use an existing custom schema or EPPO simple schema or whether to use a new schema.

li.p: If you add your topic to an existing topic-set, your topic must use the corresponding schema.
If your topic uses a new schema, you must first add a topic-set.

doing.p: Create a new file for your topic and follow the schema you selected to add your content. To add the topic to a topic-set:

li.p: If you store your topic source file in a directory that is already included in the topic-set configuration file, the build automatically adds the topic to the document.
If you store your topic file in a new directory, add the new directory path to the sources element of the topic-set configuration file.

doing.p: When you build your documents, if your topic appears in the output under the correct topic-set and contains the correct content, you have successfully added a topic to a topic-set.
